title: Clearing out the fractions
text: The first step is to multiply both sides of the equation by a number that will clear out the fractions. In other words, we will multiply both sides of the equation by the least common multiple of the two denominators.

title: Using Distributive Property
text: Now we get the cleared-up equation $$2\left(q+3\right)=5(q-3)$$. The next step is to use distributive property to get rid of the parantheses.

title: Definition of Distributive Property
text: Distributive Property is the property such that $$a \left(b+c\right)=a b+a c$$, where a,b, and c are constants
speech: Distributive Property is the property such that  a, parentheses b plus c,  is equal to, a b plus a c , where a,b, and c are constants

, where a,b, and c are constants

title: Using Distributive Property
text: After distributing, we get the equation $$2q+6=5q-15$$.

title: Solving for q
